Package cz.cuni.mff.soukups3.PipeWeb

Class Backend

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.soukups3.PipeWeb.Backend
public class Backend extends Object
This is a class describing a users backend with all the info that is needed.

This class is a multiton which can be accessed by 2 ways. Either by giving a name and a password or by giving an HTMLSession with a name already present.

    • list

      public static Collection<Backend> list()
      Get all available backends.
      Returns:
      All available backends.

    • forName

      public static Backend forName(String name, String password)
      Get a Backend for a name with given password, or null if incorrect
      Parameters:
      name - userName
      password - unencrypted password
      Returns:
      wanted Backend or null

    • forName

      public static Backend forName(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)

      Note This should be removed and logging in should be supported just by name and password (you can set the name in the session without the correct password, but since this webpage should be run in a secure network where all users aren't malicious, this is not a big issue)

      Parameters:
      session - A session with a userName set
      Returns:
      wanted Backend

    • createBackend

      public static boolean createBackend(String name, String unEncodedPass, String path) throws KeyAlreadyExistsException
      Create a backend with the given properties
      Parameters:
      name - the userName
      unEncodedPass - password as entered by the user
      path - path to the root directory
      Throws:
      KeyAlreadyExistsException - if a username already exists.

    • saveBackends

      public static void saveBackends()
      Save backends to the DB_PATH file.

    • addScript

      public void addScript(Script newScript, boolean hardCopy)
      Add a script to the backend either by hard-linking to the scripts folder or by copying it there
      Parameters:
      newScript - the script to be added
      hardCopy - if true copy to the folder else hard-link
